intro: Anaxagorea javanica var. tripetala, commonly known as the three-lobed sterculia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with three distinct lobes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
